Posts.Content: Hi Lucy I hope you are ok.  It will be hard telling your young daughter perhaps a Macmillan nurse could give you some advise on how to tell her? But I think you should tell her and not hide what is going on. Sending a big hug xx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: I am waiting for a second biopsy which is delayed due to a infection and hematoma after my first biopsy. Next one due hopefully on 9 April So until then will not have a certain diagnosis I am eating and eating until I feel sick (binging) I was losing weight before this and was healthy eating I am quite large and had lost 5 stone but need to lose more How can I control this mad eating? I feel totally out of control. My emotions are all over the place,
Posts.Title: Overeating while in the waiting game

Posts.Content: I posted  a while ago about my biopsy problems After 5 months of lots of mammograms, ultrasound, 3 biopsy's, 2 infections, a biopsy which bled for 9 weeks, a hematoma, today I got a result No cancer I have a little calcification and a small fat necrosis which may have been caused by my first biopsy. Back on the normal 3 year mammogram program Thank you all for your support, See my other posts Good luck to your all on your own journeys I hope you all have positive outcome Apology if this is also in another post the system doesn't seem to be working well
Posts.Title: At last a result

Posts.Content: Great items ladies Will get my knitting back out I also make cards Here are a few things I recently made Usually make for charity
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: I love the felting. Is it wet or dry felting? I have some dry felting kits you use needles to mat the felt together. Need to try it. At the moment I am for the first time knitting socks on 5 needles. Learning from the internet. Made the first one and its fine working on the second. Saw a lady at the breast clinic who makes beautiful fair isle style socks for the local hospice she was knitting as she was waiting for her appointment. Trying to keep busy with crafting. I have until July to wait for another biopsy. I must have the longest wait in history between biopsy`s, My first was at the end of February which caused a hematoma and infection. 7 weeks on still got both. Will need to ring doctors next week as I am not getting much better from the infected wound however hematoma has reduced. Keep crafting x
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Hi  Sorry to hear the news. My Mam had breast cancer twice 20 years ago and lived a long and happy life My Sister also had breast cancer in both breasts 3 years ago and is now doing fine I have been recalled and am awaiting another biopsy delayed because of infections and hematoma for 3 months So don`t worry the NHS is fab and you will get the best treatment available. I have seen it with my family first hand I should heed my own words as I was and still am worried about what will happen to me. Take care and keep posting
Posts.Title: Recall for Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi, I had my first biopsy on 23 February 2018.  Suspicious mammogram but biopsy came back clear, result received on 6 March. However the hospital wanted another biopsy as mammogram suspicious. Went back on 7 March but because of a hematoma they couldn't do it. Was given another appointment for 9 April for biopsy But due to size of hematoma, infection and lots of bleeding went back to the hospital on 28 March As the hematoma is large, I have now been told the next biopsy will be delayed an will now be at the start of July At first thought if it is a cancer it will be very early, and this delay will be ok. 3 months waiting is a long time, but I understand they need another tissue sample and this cannot be done with the hematoma. Now I am getting anxious thinking if I have cancer will it grow quickly in these 3 months? Does anyone know how long a very early stage cancer takes to grow?
Posts.Title: 2nd biospy delayed by 3 months.

Posts.Content: Thanks toxophilite for your reply. Its lovely that you replied to my post I feel a bit of a fraud posting on here because I have not been diagnosed with Cancer. You are all amazing people. I wish I could be strong. I feel alone and frightened, not knowing what my outcome will be, is causing me to go into a very dark place. I have nobody to give me a hug, be with me, talk to me, understand me. This morning I have decided, to stop talking about it as I think everyone is fed up about what I feel like. Thanks everyone on here for your kind words and helpful advise. You are all awesome xx So thanks everyone,
Posts.Title: 2nd biospy delayed by 3 months.
